intro: Silene acaulis f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered rock catchfly, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. It features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters at the tips of its stems. The plant is native to alpine and arctic regions, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention in harsh environments. Silene acaulis f. albiflora is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy, often brightly colored flowers.
